page.title: 16Smythemoor.
page.content: There are two small-holdings and three houses at Smythemoor.Thirteen people live there.The owner of the first small holding has an orchard and 15 acres of grazing grass which is sown. She also grows hay to feed the cattle in winter.The owner of the second small holding has a son who works at Boundary Farm. The first house is called Marsden Lodge.The owner has seven goats and keeps bees.The owner of the second house is the Matron of Quarry House for old people in Market Drayton.The third house was built in about 1785. It has two acres of mixed woodland. Smythemoor is boggy because it is about 100 feet below sea level and the soil is peat.The road leading to Smythemoor has recently been repaired because it began to sink.Smythemoor lane is unadopted and full of potholes
